channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Home prices hit an all-time high even as the housing market slowdown deepens
item.description: The housing market saw a deeper slowdown in June, as sales of existing homes dropped.

item.title: ‘His income is limited’: Should I pay $800 a month towards my husband’s $67,000 student debt?
item.description: “I have stopped short of paying for his business, his car payment and health insurance.”

item.title: Drinking alcohol more than three times a week can put your finances at risk
item.description: Alcohol can quietly undermine financial control, decision-making and long-term security.

item.title: European Central Bank likely to put rate cuts on pause amid trade uncertainty
item.description: Inflation at the ECB’s 2% target encourages a wait-and-see approach.

item.title: GE Vernova says tariff impact will be less than thought, and the stock soars toward two records
item.description: GE Vernova’s stock was heading for a record high after an earnings beat, a raised full-year outlook and a lowered estimate of tariff impact.

item.title: Bank of America raises price target on Amazon ahead of earnings
item.description: Analyst Justin Post reiterated his buy rating on Amazon and lifted his price target ahead of the e-commerce giant's quarterly report expected on July ...

item.title: No near-term lifeline from China for Nvidia's H20 chips
item.description: The company previously told analysts that revenue from these chips will be negligible until at least the fourth quarter.

item.title: Jefferies sees Mike Novogratz's Galaxy Digital rallying another 20%
item.description: Galaxy Digital is poised to benefit from clearer cryptocurrency regulations as well as demand for AI data centers, according to Jefferies.

item.title: The AI 'neoclouds' buzz is growing on Wall Street, but risks are bubbling
item.description: "Last year, [neoclouds] were very small, but now it's something that you cannot ignore in terms of size," UBS strategist Sundeep Gantori told CNBC.
